org.dgfoundation.amp.ar

Class Column<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.ar.Viewable
      • org.dgfoundation.amp.ar.Column<K>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ColumnIdentifiable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CellColumn, GroupColumn

    public abstract class Column<K>
extends Viewable
implements ColumnIdentifiable
    Wraps the items that can be displayed in a report column. A Column can hold CellS,other ColumnS or some more exotic structures that are yet to be defined ...
    Since:
    May 31, 2006

      • relatedContentPersisterClass

        protected java.lang.Class relatedContentPersisterClass
        The hibernate bean that holds information relative to this cell. This cell is a usually a subset of the information that the content persister class holds.

      • dimensionClass

        protected java.lang.Class dimensionClass
        This class controls the behaviour of dimensions. a dimension is cross hierarchy linking between objects. For example Sector and Sub-Sector share the same dimension, thus they are subject of filtering while in nested hierarchy

      • getRowSpanInHeading_internal

        protected abstract int getRowSpanInHeading_internal()
        only to be used internally during initialization of the layout. Real uses of the code should go to getPositionInHeading()
        notice that the reports engine might decide for the column to have more rows than the one specified by this function (for filling the heading upto the bottom) - but never less
        Returns:

      • getOwnerIds

      • getTrailCells

        public abstract java.util.List<? extends AmountCell> getTrailCells()
        Produces a list of trail CellS. These are usually custom made cells that represent some information regarding the Column, that are usually displayed at the bottom of the column. For AmountCellColumnS this is the place to display totals. However, other types of behaviour can be implemented, like error reporting for debugging purposes
        Returns:
        the list of trail cells

      • verticalSplitByCateg

        public abstract GroupColumn verticalSplitByCateg(java.lang.String category,
                                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.Long> ids,
                                                 boolean generateTotalCols,
                                                 AmpReports reportMetadata)
        Helper method that only uses one category to create a categorized tree. Returns null if categorizing failed for some reasons
        Parameters:
        src - The source column to be categorized
        category - the category to categorize the data with
        generateTotalCols - true when creating TotalAmountColumnS instead of CellColumnS
        Returns:
        a GroupColumn that holds the categorized Data
        See Also:
        verticalSplitByCategs

      • verticalSplitByCateg

        public GroupColumn verticalSplitByCateg(java.lang.String category,
                                        boolean generateTotalCols,
                                        AmpReports reportMetadata)

      • verticalSplitByCategs

        public Column verticalSplitByCategs(java.util.List<java.lang.String> categories,
                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.Long> ids,
                                    boolean generateTotalCols,
                                    AmpReports reportMetadata)
        Split a column holding CategAmountCellS into several subcolumns based on the categorized amount data and some categories given as reference. The result will be a categorized column tree of GroupColumnS and CellColumnS as leafs. Each category will create another level on the tree while on the same level we will find several GroupColumnS that share the same metainfo category but not the same value.
        Parameters:
        src - The source CellColumn to be categorized
        categories - the list of categories to be applied to the src column
        generateTotalCols - true when creating TotalAmountColumnS instead of CellColumnS
        Returns:
        a GroupColumn that holds the categorized data
        See Also:
        MetaInfo, TotalAmountColumn, CategAmountCell

      • verticalSplitByCategs

        public Column verticalSplitByCategs(java.util.List<java.lang.String> categories,
                                    boolean generateTotalCols,
                                    AmpReports reportMetadata)
        convenience method for not specifying ids
        Parameters:
        categories -
        generateTotalCols -
        reportMetadata -
        Returns:
